desc: Full HP and MP recovery to <item_tgt>.
Recover HP beyond max health to <item_tgt> but has a chance to inflict Charm/Confusion/Mirage.
Weak Light attack to <item_tgt>. Chance of instakill when striking weakness.
Weak Dark attack to <item_tgt>. Chance of instakill when striking weakness.
Heavy Light attack to <item_tgt>. Chance of instakill when striking weakness.
Heavy Dark attack to <item_tgt>. Chance of instakill when striking weakness.
Greatly increases the damage of next Strength-based attack for <item_tgt>.
Greatly increases the damage of next Magic-based attack for <item_tgt>.
Guarantees the next Strength-based attack for <item_tgt> will be both 100% accurate and a Critical hit.
Weak Almighty MP drain attack to <item_tgt>.
Weak Almighty HP/MP drain attack to <item_tgt>.
Reflects a Physical attack once for <item_tgt> for 1 turn.
Reflects a Magic attack once for <item_tgt> for 1 turn.
When the Nahobino's HP reaches 0, the item is sacrificed to revive him at full HP.
Guarantees escape from battle upon use.
Nullifies a Physical attack against <item_tgt> once for 1 turn.
Nullifies a Fire attack against <item_tgt> once for 1 turn.
Nullifies an Ice attack against <item_tgt> once for 1 turn.
Nullifies an Electric attack once for <item_tgt> for 1 turn.
Nullifies a Force attack against <item_tgt> once for 1 turn.
Nullifies a Light attack against <item_tgt> once for 1 turn.
Nullifies a Dark attack against <item_tgt> once for 1 turn.
Return to the last visited leyline fount. Item is not consumed upon use.
Prevents any enemy encounters until next New Moon.
Grants the Nahobino enough EXP to level up.
Grants a demon at a lower level than the Nahobino enough EXP to level up.
Increases a demon’s Phys skill potential by 1. (max: +9)
Increases a demon’s Fire skill potential by 1. (max: +9)
Increases a demon’s Ice skill potential by 1. (max: +9)

Increases a demon's Healing skill potential by 1. (max: +5)
Increases a demon's Support skill potential by 1. (max: +5)
Increases a demon’s Ailment skill potential by 1. (max: +9)

A small fortune neatly folded up tight. Though it cannot be read, there's a chance something good may be written on it.
A can filled to the brim with a mysterious liquid. It smells dangerous at first, but quickly becomes rather enticing.
A figurine that has melted due to the harsh environment. It's stuck to the bottom of the capsule and can't be pulled out.
A disposable cloth mask. Seeing as both sides are covered in sand, it would actually be quite dangerous to use now.
A popular video game console from back in the day. The cartridge slot is filled with sand, so it probably won't work.
A piece of worn-out building material. It's chipped all over and, at the right angle, even resembles a human arm.
A card with a hexagram drawn on the back. The front shows a young man wth an odd machine attached to his left arm.
A can filled to the brim with jelly. The more you shake it, the more the jelly gets broken up, making it easier to drink.
A paperweight with the picture of a once popular anime character. Clear off some rust, and it should be good as new.
A shirt meant to be worn under one's clothes. Since it's full of holes, it might better serve as a dustcloth or two.
A popular video game console from back in the day. Seeing as it's packed with sand, it doesn't seem like it'd work at all.
A mummy of a rat that must've lived somewhere in the city. It will likely break with little force, due to poor preservation.
A magnetic card once used to make calls. A lovely picture graces the front, and it seems to have expired 18 years ago.
A can filled with oden, a Japanese hotpot dish. A plastic toothpick on the lid allows for immediate consumption.
A machine that plays beautiful music with the press of a button. There are others of various shapes, buttons, and music.
A swimsuit issued for PE class. Given its shape and material, it was likely used for some form of water exercise.
A popular game console from way back. It includes a disc tray and two rectangular holes, possibly for cartridges.
A mummified crow that looks as if it could fly away any moment. Seems they come in a variety of beaks and heads.
A card with a hologram processed on its front side. Most likely a rare item. A hexagram is drawn on the back.
A tin can filled with someone's memories. Perhaps it's best to leave this be.
A box filled with rubber balloons. There's an expiration date printed on the side of the box.
A shirt from long ago that was never worn. It's fairly clean and, despite being 18 years old, has yet to go out of style.
A popular game console from way back. Though left to the elements, it's so sturdy that it can still be powered on.
A mummy of an indistinguishable organism. It'd be best not to think about what it will be used for after it you sell it.
A thin box with two rolls of black tape. There doesn’t seem to be a place to grab the tape.
A manga that is ripped up here and there. It is about a one-armed young man traveling through the netherworld.
A PET bottle capable of holding a great amount. The liquid inside has an eerie glow to it.
A tool used to defend against rain. It cannot protect you from the hardships of life, however.
A box with a strange powder spilling out from the cracks. There are several types, but they all smell good.
A box meant for cans and bottles. It was designed to be stackable.
A box loaded with some kind of spherical food. Some of the balls have cooked stingray inside.
A duck doll that floats in water. It is prized by collectors all over.
An 18-year-old newspaper. Useful for wrapping fragile items and wiping windows.
An 18-year-old occult magazine full of articles on the supernatural.
A travel-sized book about a demon's struggle to enter paradise.
A magazine wrapped in plastic. It's probably worth more if left as is.
A bottle sealed with cardboard. Opening it releases a sweet and sour scent.
A bottle plugged up with a marble. How one goes about opening it is unknown.
An apron dress with cute frills. The skirt is short, making it easy to move around.
A yellow rock-like object cut into a triangle. It is coated with honey.
Fruit of the gods under the care of the goddess Idun. It holds a strong life force within.
A talisman that grants protection from fire with the name Akiha-Gongen written across it.
A key that represents one of the pillars of the Empyrean. It symbolizes the austerity a king must cast upon himself.
A key that represents one of the pillars of the Empyrean. It symbolizes the deep benevolence a king must have for others.
A key that represents one of the pillars of the Empyrean. It symbolizes the harmony a king must create.
A large egg roughly the size of a human head. It is quite heavy.
A root of a Mandrake. A rare medicinal ingredient with various efficacies.
A feather from a Thunderbird. It feels like soft metal, and emits electricity.
One of the talismans that makes up the body of a Shiki-Ouji. It was supposedly written by a renowned onmyoji long ago.
A mysterious pot that can capture demons. It's said to have been made by a blind human 30 years ago.
A large bottle that drains life from humans. Kumbhanda wants you to deliver it to Succubus.
A love letter written by a hopelessly romantic demon. It is illegible due to either bad handwriting or the demonic script.
A slice of king salmon that is still barely edible, thanks to a King Frost that was keeping it frozen.
A godly stone that could very well be used as a divine housing shrine. The Kunitsu Oyamatsumi's power is held within.
A high-end model of the Paul-Les series known as the Black Widow. Its black sheen gives it a touch of class.
A large model kit. The name of a flower has been printed on the packaging along with the words \"Test Model 3.\"
A monitor shaped like a magatama with a game console built inside.
The horn of a Holy demon. Bursting with power, it is said to symbolize abundance.
An iridescent jewel that is thought to have lined the storefronts of jewelry stores before the great destruction.
A beaming red jewel that is thought to have lined the storefronts of jewelry stores before the great destruction.
A light blue, shimmering jewel that is thought to have lined the storefronts of jewelry stores before the great destruction.
An extremely hard scale. Said to be from a powerful dragon.
The head of Girimekhala. This will supposedly be made into a watering can.
A legendary sword said to have been held by a great emperor.
A symbol of the sun god's power. It is also one of the sun god's eyes, having been removed at some point in time.
A ring that is said to hold the power of a seraph-class archangel. It seems to have lost its power at this time.
A mysterious seed given only to those who have been acknowledged by Sophia.
A head of the Beast Inugami. A powerful grudge restlessly stirs within.
A horn of the Wilder Bicorn. It is supposedly used to make a form of hexing medicine.
The head of a former sun god. The eyes appear to have been gouged out by someone.
A contract written in an unknown script. It holds the power of the Tyrant Mephisto.
Makeup that is applied around one's eyes. It holds the power of the Femme Cleopatra.
A Menorah given by Sophia. It represents the hidden sefirah.
A Menorah obtained from Matador. It represents the ninth sefirah.
A Menorah obtained from Daisoujou. It represents the seventh sefirah.
A Menorah obtained from Hell Biker. It represents the eighth sefirah.
A Menorah obtained from White Rider. It represents the fourth sefirah.
A Menorah obtained from Red Rider. It represents the third sefirah.
A Menorah obtained from Black Rider. It represents the second sefirah.
A Menorah obtained from Pale Rider. It represents the first sefirah.
A Menorah obtained from Mother Harlot. It represents the sixth sefirah.
A Menorah obtained from Trumpeter. It represents the fifth sefirah.
A Menorah obtained from Demi-fiend. It represents the tenth sefirah.
A pocket book for students of Jouin High School. The name \"<pc_full_retain>\" is inside.
Food that the traveling Preta handed to you. A medley of inedible things have been mixed in.
Proof of having overcome a terribly arduous trial.
